abstract: Terry Semel failed more than any other reason, of course, because he didn’t respond properly to the challenge of Google. Number two on Mr. Semel’s list of failures, however, is he didn’t respond properly to the challenge of Facebook.
snippet: Terry Semel failed more than any other reason, of course, because he didn’t respond properly to the challenge of Google. Number two on Mr. Semel’s list of failures, however, is he didn’t respond properly to the challenge of Facebook.
lead_paragraph: Terry Semel failed as Yahoo’s chief executive more than any other reason, of course, because he didn’t respond properly to the challenge of Google. Mr. Semel passed on many opportunities simply to buy Google. And he was slow to understand Google’s key business strategies—the power of search, the money from search advertising, the enormous value in creating a network that sells ads on other Web sites, and the improbable power of running a big company like a collection of dorm room startups. What’s galling, of course, is that Yahoo was a leader in offering Web search and online advertising years before Google started.

headline.main: How Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg Shames Terry Semel
